answerText: NF-kappa-B [accept nuclear factor kappa B][10] The RANK ligand is used to activate a particular type of cell in this tissue. This tissue is the site of Ewing's sarcoma, is resorbed in response to parathyroid hormone, and is made of phosphate and calcium.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 6 | 12 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This protein shares a good deal of homology with the Rel oncogene, and it was originally discovered bound to an enhancer controlling the immunoglobulin light chain locus. For 10 points each: [10] Name this key signaling protein in the immune system, which controls several inflammation-related genes. The RANK receptor is named for its ability to activate this protein.
